decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | The proposed velux windows in the south and north elevation of the roofslope approved shall contain only obscure glass, and shall be permanently fixed shut.  A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area. | Two parking spaces at the front of the property shall be kept continuously available for car parking.  REASON:  To ensure adequate provision for car parking within the site.
description: Loft conversion comprising alteration to roof including new hip roof, raised roof ridge of rear addition and installation of dormer window in rear roof slope
